body.value: <font color="lightgrey">and, and that's the thing I think, where we find beauty in the language is it's the turn of phrase. It isn't the funny spellings of, of plantation dialect. And poets who use Black folk speech, we're never really trying to do plantation dialect that was imposed from the exterior. They were trying to capture the authenticity of Black skill: the ability to improvise and to make language, to make words.</font>
